paragraphs.content: Psalm 104
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 104

paragraphs.content: Bless the LORD, O my soul. O LORD my God, thou art very great; thou art clothed with honour and majesty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Bless the Lord, O my soul. O Lord my God, thou art very great; thou art clothed with honour and majesty.

paragraphs.content: Who coverest thyself with light as with a garment: who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who coverest thyself with light as with a garment: who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain:

paragraphs.content: Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters: who maketh the clouds his chariot: who walketh upon the wings of the wind:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters: who maketh the clouds his chariot: who walketh upon the wings of the wind:

paragraphs.content: Who maketh his angels spirits; his ministers a flaming fire:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who maketh his angels spirits; his ministers a flaming fire:

paragraphs.content: Who laid the foundations of the earth, that it should not be removed for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who laid the foundations of the earth, that it should not be removed for ever.

paragraphs.content: Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a garment: the waters stood above the mountains.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a garment: the waters stood above the mountains.

paragraphs.content: At thy rebuke they fled; at the voice of thy thunder they hasted away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: At thy rebuke they fled; at the voice of thy thunder they hasted away.

paragraphs.content: They go up by the mountains; they go down by the valleys unto the place which thou hast founded for them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They go up by the mountains; they go down by the valleys unto the place which thou hast founded for them.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over; that they turn not again to cover the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over; that they turn not again to cover the earth.

paragraphs.content: He sendeth the springs into the valleys, which run among the hills.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He sendeth the springs into the valleys, which run among the hills.

paragraphs.content: They give drink to every beast of the field: the wild asses quench their thirst.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They give drink to every beast of the field: the wild asses quench their thirst.

paragraphs.content: By them shall the fowls of the heaven have their habitation, which sing among the branches.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By them shall the fowls of the heaven have their habitation, which sing among the branches.

paragraphs.content: He watereth the hills from his chambers: the earth is satisfied with the fruit of thy works.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He watereth the hills from his chambers: the earth is satisfied with the fruit of thy works.

paragraphs.content: He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle, and herb for the service of man: that he may bring forth food out of the earth;
paragraphs.contentHtml: He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle, and herb for the service of man: that he may bring forth food out of the earth;

paragraphs.content: And wine that maketh glad the heart of man, and oil to make his face to shine, and bread which strengtheneth man’s heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And wine that maketh glad the heart of man, and oil to make his face to shine, and bread which strengtheneth man’s heart.

paragraphs.content: The trees of the LORD are full of sap; the cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted;
paragraphs.contentHtml: The trees of the Lord are full of sap; the cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted;

paragraphs.content: Where the birds make their nests: as for the stork, the fir trees are her house.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Where the birds make their nests: as for the stork, the fir trees are her house.

paragraphs.content: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats; and the rocks for the conies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats; and the rocks for the conies.

paragraphs.content: He appointed the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He appointed the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.

paragraphs.content: Thou makest darkness, and it is night: wherein all the beasts of the forest do creep forth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou makest darkness, and it is night: wherein all the beasts of the forest do creep forth.

paragraphs.content: The young lions roar after their prey, and seek their meat from God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The young lions roar after their prey, and seek their meat from God.

paragraphs.content: The sun ariseth, they gather themselves together, and lay them down in their dens.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The sun ariseth, they gather themselves together, and lay them down in their dens.

paragraphs.content: Man goeth forth unto his work and to his labour until the evening.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Man goeth forth unto his work and to his labour until the evening.

paragraphs.content: O LORD, how manifold are thy works! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord, how manifold are thy works! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.

paragraphs.content: So is this great and wide sea, wherein are things creeping innumerable, both small and great beasts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So is this great and wide sea, wherein are things creeping innumerable, both small and great beasts.

paragraphs.content: There go the ships: there is that leviathan, whom thou hast made to play therein.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There go the ships: there is that leviathan, whom thou hast made to play therein.

paragraphs.content: These wait all upon thee; that thou mayest give them their meat in due season.
paragraphs.contentHtml: These wait all upon thee; that thou mayest give them their meat in due season.

paragraphs.content: That thou givest them they gather: thou openest thine hand, they are filled with good.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That thou givest them they gather: thou openest thine hand, they are filled with good.

paragraphs.content: Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled: thou takest away their breath, they die, and return to their dust.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled: thou takest away their breath, they die, and return to their dust.

paragraphs.content: Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created: and thou renewest the face of the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created: and thou renewest the face of the earth.

paragraphs.content: The glory of the LORD shall endure for ever: the LORD shall rejoice in his works.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The glory of the Lord shall endure for ever: the Lord shall rejoice in his works.

paragraphs.content: He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth: he toucheth the hills, and they smoke.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth: he toucheth the hills, and they smoke.

paragraphs.content: I will sing unto the LORD as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will sing unto the Lord as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.

paragraphs.content: My meditation of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My meditation of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the Lord.

paragraphs.content: Let the sinners be consumed out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless thou the LORD, O my soul. Praise ye the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let the sinners be consumed out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless thou the Lord, O my soul. Praise ye the Lord.
